newsArray.title: USA legend Alexi Lalas takes a brutal swipe at Canada after it is dumped out of the World Cup in the group stages
newsArray.description: For the first time in women's football history, the reigning Olympic gold medalists have been knocked out in the Group Stages of the following World Cup.
newsArray.content: USA legend Alexi Lalas takes a brutal swipe at Canada after it is dumped out of the World Cup in the group stages Canada is out of the Women's World Cup after a humbling 4-0 defeat to Australia Lalas - ever the provocateur - didn't miss an opportunity to take a dig at Canada DailyMail.com provides all the latest international sports news By Jake Fenner For Dailymail.Com Updated: 09:41 EDT, 31 July 2023 e-mail View comments For the first time in women's football history, the reigning Olympic gold medalists have been knocked out in the Group Stages of the following World Cup. Canada, who came in with the eleventh best odds to lift the trophy in Australia, lost 4-0 to hosts Australia on Monday night in Melbourne . Coupled with a Nigeria 0-0 draw against Ireland, that meant that the Super Falcons would join the hosts in the knockout stages. Canada joins three men's teams that won the Olympic gold but got knocked out in the group stages: Czechoslovakia (gold in 1980, eliminated in 1982), the Soviet Union (gold in 1988, fell in 1990) and Cameroon (won gold in 2000, knocked out in 2002). Never one to pass up on a time to mock America's rivals, former US men's national team defender Alexi Lalas took a jab at Canada - all while former CanWNT keeper Karina Leblanc was sitting on the same desk. Alexi Lalas (far right) jumped on the opportunity to provide a sly dig at Canada's misery The goals came early and often for host nation Australia, who defeated the Canadians 4-0 This loss, coupled with a Nigeria draw, means Canada are the first women's Olympic gold medal winners in history to be knocked out in the group stages of the following World Cup "They really came out and fought. Sam Kerr did not have to play and that was exactly what they wanted." @RobStoneONFOX , @karinaleblanc , @CarliLloyd , and @AlexiLalas recap The Matildas emphatic victory over Canada as they go into the Round of 16 with incredible momentum! üá¶üá∫ pic.twitter.com/lUBjIgsiyJ ‚Äî FOX Soccer (@FOXSoccer) July 31, 2023 Lalas likened the tournament to a game of musical chairs, saying, 'the music has stopped and Canada is left without a chair. Sindely, Lalas added, 'Congratulations on winning the Gold Medal at the Olympics.' Prior to that jab, Lalas gave a pretty fair review of the state of the match. 'It was... emphatic. It was an exclamation point, and now they go into the Round of 16 with incredible momentum. Out wide they were dominant, in terms of finishing they were dominant, in set pieces they were ultimately dominant. 'And so I know Karina, this probably hurts. But it may hurt a little bit less because Canada was never even in this game. Leblanc, reluctantly added, 'I would have to agree with you. I'm proudly Canadian but I tip my hats off to Australia. They deserved it, they dominated. 'I mean you talk about that left hand side [Steph] Catley, Caitlin Foord, [Hayley] Raso, like everybody did what they needed to do today except for Canada. 'And you know, its disappointing. You're coming off an Olympic win, you hope for more but I don't think there's any Canadian who watched this game or who has played the game who would say they deserved it tonight. 'The good thing is its a home country a home team one of the things you as a former player you want that, it's good for the game but yeah, that's how it ended tonight.' It's jubilation for the host nation, who managed to win the group with this victory on Monday But it's likely the end of the road at the World Cup for Canada legends Christine Sinclair (L) and Sophie Schmidt (R) - the latter of which already announced her retirement from the team A fellow person on the desk, USWNT legend Carli Lloyd praised Australia, saying they were better, 'In every aspect of the game. From start to finish, they scored early - we said it in the pre-game the team that was going to score early was the team that was most likely going to come out and win this game. 'I thought defensively they were compact they made it really difficult for Canada to go centrally. And Foord, in her more natural position out on that left hand side between her and Catley just deadly they made so much happen. Raso getting on the end of those goals, they really came out and fought and Sam Kerr did not have to play and that's exactly what they wanted.' As for Canada, this defeat marks the country's fifth Group Stage exit at a Women's World Cup - following two straight knockout stage appearances. It's the final game in a Canada uniform for one of the country's brightest stars - Sophie Schmidt and likely the last World Cup game for the world's all-time leading international goal scorer Christine Sinclair. After the match, Schmidt said, 'I don't think there's any words for how we're feeling right now. We're shook, we're disappointed.' newsArray.description: SIMON JONES: Chelsea want Robert Sanchez and he has agreed to join. The problem will be the fee and Chelsea's ongoing talks over a deal for ¬£105million-rated Moises Caicedo.
newsArray.content: Chelsea want Brighton keeper Robert Sanchez - who has already agreed to join the Blues - but transfer fee and ongoing talks over ¬£105m-rated Moises Caicedo are proving an issue Robert Sanchez has fallen down the pecking order at Brighton in recent months The goalkeeper has been capped twice by Spain and was courted by England TRANSFER CONFIDENTIAL: Spurs line up Brennan Johnson if Harry Kane leaves By Simon Jones for MailOnline Updated: 09:25 EDT, 31 July 2023 e-mail View comments Chelsea want Brighton goalkeeper Robert Sanchez and he has agreed to join. The problem will be the fee and Chelsea's ongoing talks over a deal for ¬£105million-rated Moises Caicedo. Sanchez has fallen out of favour with Roberto de Zerbi and wants to get away with Chelsea a perfect opportunity. Former Brighton goalkeeping coach Ben Roberts is at Chelsea and played a big part in mentoring Sanchez's development. Indeed, the 6ft 6ins shot-stopper credits his 'mental fortitude' to Roberts's influence. Though born in Spain and capped twice by them, Sanchez counts as homegrown as he has been brought up through Brighton's academy since the age of 15, and was courted by England prior to his Spain call-up. Chelsea are eyeing a move for Brighton goalkeeper Robert Sanchez (left) this summer Mauricio Pochettino is keen to strengthen in between the sticks ahead of the new season That could prove vital with Chelsea's current recruitment pattern and the fact the likes of Conor Gallagher could still depart. Chelsea have also been maintaining contact with Southampton over Romeo Lavia and Tino Livramento. Mauricio Pochettino has confirmed new signing from Rennes, Lesley Ugochukwu, should go on loan to Strasbourg with winger Angelo Gabriel expected to follow. Regardless of shared ownership rules permit only three loans allowed between clubs. They still plan to sign striker Elye Wahi from Montpellier with Strasbourg in mind so Chelsea will need to find different temporary, or permanent, homes for a number of the players they are stockpiling. Impressive midfielder Andrey Santos has interest from eight clubs, home and abroad. The newly-promoted Premier League side have also opened talks with Arsenal for defender Auston Trusty. The Blades are pursuing a loan deal for the USA international who was player of the year at Birmingham City last season and, as Confidential readers will know, was a target for Rangers earlier this summer. Sheffield United are keen to get the deal for Trusty over the line, and are set to receive a financial injection from the sale of Iliman Ndiaye to Marseille for ¬£18million. Arsenal would ideally prefer a sale for Trusty. They need to raise funds to offset their spending and appease Financial Fair Play concerns. Sheffield United have opened talks with Arsenal's Auston Trusty and are eyeing Axel Tuanzebe Paul Heckingbottom's side are back in the Premier League after a fine Championship season Arsenal are targeting Brentford keeper David Raya, but face competition from Bayern Munich They want Brentford goalkeeper David Raya but early signs are they will offer around ¬£15m and Brentford are determined to take ¬£30m at least. Arsenal could sell Matt Turner to help the move. The USA international is one on a long list of keepers courted by Nottingham Forest who want Dean Henderson and one other to start the season. Raya is highly regarded by Arsenal keeper coach Inaki Cana who worked with the 27-year-old at Brentford and believes he can provide Aaron Ramsdale with serious competition for the number one jersey. Bayern Munich have not totally given up on Raya but they were offering a loan with obligation and are now looking at Morocco international Yassine Bouno, or 'Bono' to his friends, of Sevilla. newsArray.title: Chelsea fans convinced the Blues are signing Kylian Mbappe after hearing Enzo Fernandez's comment
newsArray.description: Mail Sport reported on Sunday night that the Blues 'want to hijack Liverpool's' sensational move for the France World Cup winner.
newsArray.content: What was that, Enzo? Chelsea fans are convinced the Blues are signing Kylian Mbappe after hearing Fernandez's comment during trophy lift amid links with a sensational swoop for the PSG star Chelsea believe they may be signing Kylian Mbappe after Sunday's victory The Blues were crowned the first Premier League Summer Series champions Fans think Enzo Fernandez revealed the transfer during the celebrations By Ed Carruthers For Mailonline Updated: 09:33 EDT, 31 July 2023 e-mail 34 shares 2 View comments Chelsea fans are convinced that Enzo Fernandez may have revealed that the club are signing Kylian Mbappe, following their Premier League Summer Series victory . Mail Sport reported on Sunday night that the Blues 'want to hijack Liverpool's' sensational move for the France World Cup winner. It comes as the 24-year-old is edging closer to an exit from Paris Saint-Germain, after the club put him up for sale and left him out of their pre-season tour last week. The forward's ongoing contract saga with the Parisian outfit has soured their relationship so much so that the club are now hoping to cash in on their superstar, with Nasser Al-Khelaifi's side having accepted a jaw-dropping ¬£259million transfer offer for the forward. It's been made clear that he does not want to join the Saudi Pro League side , with Liverpool now reportedly 'holding talks' with the Frenchman , who has 12 months remaining on his contract at the Parc des Princes. Introducing your first-ever #PLSummerSeries champions: @ChelseaFC ! üèÜ pic.twitter.com/yFWiGzXqzO ‚Äî Premier League (@premierleague) July 30, 2023 Both Chelsea and Liverpool are interested in signing Kylian Mbappe (pictured) with the French superstar's future at Paris Saint-Germain very much up in the air Chelsea, meanwhile, hoisted the Premier League Summer Series title yesterday, and fans believe they over heard Enzo Fernandez (third from left) saying the Frenchman's name Chelsea, meanwhile, are also interested in signing the superstar and their fans seem to think that he could be on his way to Stamford Bridge after their Argentine midfielder was seemingly overheard to be saying his name after their 2-0 victory against Fulham on Sunday. Mauricio Pochettino's side subsequently clinched the pre-season title, having gone unbeaten in the tournament in the US, with Reece James and Thiago Silva stepping forward to lift the trophy alongside their team-mates. And just as they hoisted the cup into the air, fans believe they overheard their midfielder, Fernandez, saying Mbappe's name. 'I heard it loud and clear,' one said, while another added: 'Hearing that for the first time... What's he onto?' 'Can't wait for Boehly to offer Mbappe a 10-year contract,' one wrote. 'Proper weird thing to think of saying in the moment tbh... unless he knows something we dont,' another Twitter user added, posting a thinking-face emoji with the Tweet. Fans have been reacting on Twitter to claims that they overheard Enzo Fernandez say Mbappe's name during their trophy celebrations Pochettino has remained tight-lipped on the potential to sign Mbappe (pictured) in the past According to the Daily Record , Chelsea would be interested in signing the French forward in a player plus-cash deal. But Pochettino last week refused to confirm that his side were interested in signing Mbappe claiming that the situation was 'delicate.' 'I need to be conscious,' the manager told Sky Sports after his side's 1-1 draw against Newcastle last week. 'I cannot talk because everything that you talk is too much noise, it is a very delicate situation and it is a situation they need to fix in Paris with Kylian, Kylian with PSG 'But from our side, nothing to say. We are working in our reality, their reality is different - and they for sure have another reality. 'And from my side, nothing to say - only to support them and hope they find the best solution for both sides.' newsArray.content: AUCKLAND (AFP): Nouhaila Benzina became the first player to wear a hijab during a Women‚Äôs World Cup game when she sported the Muslim headscarf in Morocco‚Äôs match against South Korea on Sunday. World governing body FIFA lifted its ban on footballers wearing the hijab nearly a decade ago, after previous concerns over player safety. The 25-year-old defender Benzina, who plays her club football in Morocco, ran out against South Korea in Adelaide to write her name in the history books. Benzina shared social media posts in the lead-up to the World Cup about wearing a hijab, but has not spoken to the media in Australia and New Zealand about it. She told broadcaster Al Jazeera recently it would be a proud moment. ‚ÄúLots of work was done over many years, and thank God it had a positive result,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúWe hope to play at a high level and honour Moroccans.‚Äù Several other sports have lifted hijab bans in recent years including basketball, but it is still not allowed during official football matches in France. The Moroccan women, coached by Frenchman Reynald Pedros, are at their first Women‚Äôs World Cup on the back of a historic runners-up finish at the 2022 Women‚Äôs Africa Cup of Nations. They were thrashed 6-0 by Germany in their tournament opener, with Benzina remaining on the bench.

newsArray.title: Canadian star is busted in X-rated outburst about match-winning Matilda Hayley Raso - and it went to air uncensored during World Cup clash
newsArray.description: Sideline microphones have captured the disgusting spray a Canadian player delivered to Matildas hero Hayley Raso as she lay prone on the ground in Australia's 4-0 win on Monday night.
newsArray.content: Canadian star is busted in X-rated outburst about match-winning Matilda Hayley Raso - and it went to air uncensored during World Cup clash Matildas thrashed Canada 4-0 Substitute Canadian player was not pleased Launched foul-mouthed spray By Josh Alston For Daily Mail Australia Updated: 13:51 BST, 31 July 2023 e-mail 1 View comments Sideline microphones have captured the disgusting spray a Canadian player delivered to Matildas hero Hayley Raso as she lay prone on the ground in Australia's 4-0 win on Monday night. It was do-or-die for the two nations in the final World Cup group match in Melbourne and the home side shot out of the blocks to dominate from the outset - even as captain Sam Kerr remained benched with a calf injury . Raso was named best on ground with two clutch goals that handed Australia a place in the knockout stages and their first win over powerhouse Canada since 2008. There was plenty of feeling in the match, with the Canadians ranked seventh in the world and fancied to go deep in the tournament prior to the Matildas demolition job. Chapman was not happy with something Australian coach Tony Gustavsson and launched a mighty, foul-mouthed spray in return Raso came off second best in the content but Chapman was not willing to concede that it was her fault after the challenge With the result all but secured, Canadian player Allysha Chapman collided with Raso, with the Australian coming off second best and requiring medical attention on the pitch. Australia coach Tony Gustavsson had some words for Chapman that weren't picked up on the broadcast, and the Canadian erupted in reply. 'She f***ing jumped into me you t***!' she yelled. Commentator David Basheer said: 'Allysha Chapman looked over to Tony Gustavsson and said some pretty stern words. 'It was just a coming together, really. It wasn't Chapman's doing. 'It was just Raso's determination to win the ball.' 'I don't think there was any real malice in the challenge,' fellow commentator and former Matilda Grace Gill added. 'A coming together of bodies, Raso coming off a little worse for wear.' Gustavsson and Raso had the last laugh, sharing an embrace after the Matildas smashed Canada 4-0 to dump them out of the tournament Commentators agreed that the collision was accidental, with both players having eyes only for the ball Fans were disgusted by the tirade, especially as it occured while Raso was down and potentially injured. 'Allysha Chapman‚Äôs foul mouth and evil ways make me sick,' one fan posted. 'Look at the scoreboard, you t***. Sincerely, Australia,' replied another. 'Allysha Chapman displaying the most fight this [Canadian team] have shown this tournament,' posted a third. Oooh, langage, Allysha Chapman! üòÇ ‚Äî Emil (@EmilASoccer) July 31, 2023 Raso had the last laugh, though, with the Matildas topping their group for the first time in a World Cup thanks in large part to her heroics. 'Getting a tattoo of Hayley Raso‚Äôs face on my face,' one enthusiastic fan proclaimed. 'Hayley Raso. Absolute gun of a player,' posted another. 'This has been a Hayley Raso masterclass,' added another. Australia now wait on the result of the Group D clash between England and China to see who their opposition will be in the round of 16. The Matildas will now focus on emulating or bettering their quarter final appearances at the 2007, 2011 and 2015 World Cup tournaments. newsArray.title: Matildas player ratings: See which Australian stars excelled and who struggled in World Cup demolition of Canada
newsArray.description: In an display that was light years ahead of their effort in the shock loss to Nigeria last week, the Matildas were dominant from the first whistle to the last against Canada.
newsArray.content: Matildas player ratings: See which Australian stars excelled and who struggled in World Cup demolition of Canada Aussies dominant from the outset in 4-0 win Hayley Raso named best on ground with two goals Mary Fowler also among home team's best By Kristy Williams For Daily Mail Australia Updated: 13:56 BST, 31 July 2023 e-mail View comments The Matildas were dominant against Canada from start to finish despite the crushing pressure of knowing their home World Cup would have been over if they'd lost in Melbourne following their shock defeat to Nigeria last Thursday. Hayley Raso scored a double, Mary Fowler should have had two herself but had one controversially ruled offside by the VAR, and stand-in skipper Steph Catley put an exclamation point on proceedings with a late penalty. It was the biggest win by a Matildas side at any World Cup - and even better, the Aussies were so firmly in control that injured superstar Sam Kerr never had to be called on. Here's how Daily Mail Australia rated the home team... Mackenzie Arnold: 8.5 Made a few poor errors last game that may have dented the confidence, but 'Macca' was back at her best in this match, pulling off a couple of crucial saves but also returning to the brilliant distributor she had been. Ellie Carpenter: 6 Brilliant to see the Lyon star at least back to some decent form. She is such a talented player - one of the best in the world - but where has that spark gone? Carpenter was determined to defend better than the diabolical Nigeria match, and she certainly did that, but Aussies want to see the superstar they fell in love with. Clare Hunt: 8.5 The girl from the tiny town of Grenfell (NSW), was mammoth. Not many better players on the field than Hunt, who has well and truly played Kennedy and Polkinhorne out of the first-choice CB spot. The challenges she won, the time she won them and the distribution she afforded those ahead of her were phenomenal. She won't want the attention but she was as important as any Aussie player. Alanna Kennedy: 6.5 Many expected her to concede her place to Clare Polkinghorne, but Gustavsson picked his most talented centre back. While she didn't reach the heights of a brilliant game against Ireland, she was calmer than the Ireland match and despite a few passing errors she was Steph Catley: 8.5 Goodness, has the stand-in skipper stood up or what? Faded, as expected given the state of the match, as the game went on but the Arsenal jet was at her lethal best down the left - setting up the opening goal with an exquisite touch. Then came the defensive grunt - she was strong. Hayley Raso: 9 Hang it in the Louvre. The fan favourite celebrating a goal that sent the entire nation nuts to open the scoring was one thing - but the new Real Madrid signee kept showing her new Galactico club why they brought her in. Relentless as always but her positioning and nous were brilliant, and she seemed to regain confidence and composure with her first touch, and the fact she, yet again, often finished behind Carpenter showed how hard she worked. Katrina Gorry: 7 Not the workhorse's greatest match, with a fair few very, heavy touches, but the side is so much better for her in it, regardless. Looks to be very sore, and will be more crucial than Sam Kerr when it comes to the playoffs. Worked herself sore, and chased every mistake. Kyra Cooney-Cross: 7.5 A brilliant distributor, Gorry might have been the side's most important passer, but this Young Matilda has been sensational. Did she get found out? Don't think so. She never looks flustered, but has a better touch than her veteran counterpart. Emily Van Egmond: 6 Flirted between centre midfield and forwards, and wasn't much of an influence in either. But she certainly didn't let anyone down, despite not posing much of a threat. Caitlin Foord: 9 The happiest person in the Australian side Mary Fowler could play. The shackles were unleashed and the Arsenal star looked like a different player, free of the huge burden she looked to shoulder in the Nigeria loss. The first touch, the through balls...the effort chasing back in defence - she was a woman possessed. Mary Fowler: 9 Fowler is ecstatic after her goal gave the Aussies a 3-0 lead - after her first score was controversially called back for offside by the VAR One thing's for sure, when Sam Kerr (hopefully) lines up in the Round of 16, Mary Fowler will be there either way. What a stunning performance. The first touch, the dribbling, the passing... it's all Mary's world and we are just living in it. Clare Polkinghorne: N/A Subbed on late, as she has the last two, and fortunately didn't need to make a difference in this one. newsArray.title: Urgent warning ahead of Dublin‚Äôs homecoming celebrations as fans warned of severe issues around All-Ireland celebrations
creator: Vincent Whelan
newsArray.content: DUBLIN fans intent on attending the homecoming for their All-Ireland winning heroes have been warned to take heed of several instructions. Fresh off an epic win over their greatest rivals Kerry , the capital will see a huge celebration occur in Smithfield Square on Monday evening. The event is due to get under way from 6.30 pm. However, supporters are being advised to allow plenty of time in order to get there on time since it will be guaranteed to be extremely busy. In addition to that, access to Smithfield Square is only going to permitted from North King Street, Friary Avenue and Thundercut Alley. The miserable weather means attendees should also allow extra time to ensure they get there safe and sound. Dublin City Council is asking people to use public transport when travelling to and from the event, which is a family-friendly alcohol-free event. The Lord Mayor Daith√≠ de R√≥iste said: ‚ÄúWinning an All-Ireland title is always amazing, but beating Kerry in the final? "It doesn‚Äôt come much better than that! "I can‚Äôt wait to see everyone in Smithfield this evening. Let‚Äôs have a party and celebrate the boys in blue!‚Äù There will be entertainment provided on the evening, before the team takes to the stage to be welcomed by MC and RTE commentator Marty Morrissey. To celebrate the team‚Äôs achievement, Beckett Bridge and the Smithfield Sails will light up in blue both on Sunday evening and Monday evening. While Sunday's match was similarly blighted by the weather, it still wound up being a fascinating battle. Dublin were in most people's eyes the marginally better side over the course of the seventy-odd minutes. They had been in control prior to David Clifford pulling a magical pass out of nowhere just before half-time like a magician pulling a rabbit out of his hat. That teed up Paul Geaney's composed finish into the back of the net to send the Munster kingpins in at the break with a one-point lead. But Gavin White's costly turnover around the 50th minute resulted in Paddy Small blasting home a goal of their own. And while the defending champions fought resolutely to the bitter end, The Sky Blues kicked for home thanks to late scores from Brian Fenton and sub Dean Rock.

newsArray.title: USA legend Alexi Lalas takes a brutal swipe at Canada after it is dumped out of the World Cup in the group stages
newsArray.description: For the first time in women's football history, the reigning Olympic gold medalists have been knocked out in the Group Stages of the following World Cup.
newsArray.content: USA legend Alexi Lalas takes a brutal swipe at Canada after it is dumped out of the World Cup in the group stages Canada is out of the Women's World Cup after a humbling 4-0 defeat to Australia Lalas - ever the provocateur - didn't miss an opportunity to take a dig at Canada DailyMail.com provides all the latest international sports news By Jake Fenner For Dailymail.Com Updated: 09:41 EDT, 31 July 2023 e-mail View comments For the first time in women's football history, the reigning Olympic gold medalists have been knocked out in the Group Stages of the following World Cup. Canada, who came in with the eleventh best odds to lift the trophy in Australia, lost 4-0 to hosts Australia on Monday night in Melbourne . Coupled with a Nigeria 0-0 draw against Ireland, that meant that the Super Falcons would join the hosts in the knockout stages. Canada joins three men's teams that won the Olympic gold but got knocked out in the group stages: Czechoslovakia (gold in 1980, eliminated in 1982), the Soviet Union (gold in 1988, fell in 1990) and Cameroon (won gold in 2000, knocked out in 2002). Never one to pass up on a time to mock America's rivals, former US men's national team defender Alexi Lalas took a jab at Canada - all while former CanWNT keeper Karina Leblanc was sitting on the same desk. Alexi Lalas (far right) jumped on the opportunity to provide a sly dig at Canada's misery The goals came early and often for host nation Australia, who defeated the Canadians 4-0 This loss, coupled with a Nigeria draw, means Canada are the first women's Olympic gold medal winners in history to be knocked out in the group stages of the following World Cup "They really came out and fought. Sam Kerr did not have to play and that was exactly what they wanted." @RobStoneONFOX , @karinaleblanc , @CarliLloyd , and @AlexiLalas recap The Matildas emphatic victory over Canada as they go into the Round of 16 with incredible momentum! üá¶üá∫ pic.twitter.com/lUBjIgsiyJ ‚Äî FOX Soccer (@FOXSoccer) July 31, 2023 Lalas likened the tournament to a game of musical chairs, saying, 'the music has stopped and Canada is left without a chair. Sindely, Lalas added, 'Congratulations on winning the Gold Medal at the Olympics.' Prior to that jab, Lalas gave a pretty fair review of the state of the match. 'It was... emphatic. It was an exclamation point, and now they go into the Round of 16 with incredible momentum. Out wide they were dominant, in terms of finishing they were dominant, in set pieces they were ultimately dominant. 'And so I know Karina, this probably hurts. But it may hurt a little bit less because Canada was never even in this game. Leblanc, reluctantly added, 'I would have to agree with you. I'm proudly Canadian but I tip my hats off to Australia. They deserved it, they dominated. 'I mean you talk about that left hand side [Steph] Catley, Caitlin Foord, [Hayley] Raso, like everybody did what they needed to do today except for Canada. 'And you know, its disappointing. You're coming off an Olympic win, you hope for more but I don't think there's any Canadian who watched this game or who has played the game who would say they deserved it tonight. 'The good thing is its a home country a home team one of the things you as a former player you want that, it's good for the game but yeah, that's how it ended tonight.' It's jubilation for the host nation, who managed to win the group with this victory on Monday But it's likely the end of the road at the World Cup for Canada legends Christine Sinclair (L) and Sophie Schmidt (R) - the latter of which already announced her retirement from the team A fellow person on the desk, USWNT legend Carli Lloyd praised Australia, saying they were better, 'In every aspect of the game. From start to finish, they scored early - we said it in the pre-game the team that was going to score early was the team that was most likely going to come out and win this game. 'I thought defensively they were compact they made it really difficult for Canada to go centrally. And Foord, in her more natural position out on that left hand side between her and Catley just deadly they made so much happen. Raso getting on the end of those goals, they really came out and fought and Sam Kerr did not have to play and that's exactly what they wanted.' As for Canada, this defeat marks the country's fifth Group Stage exit at a Women's World Cup - following two straight knockout stage appearances. It's the final game in a Canada uniform for one of the country's brightest stars - Sophie Schmidt and likely the last World Cup game for the world's all-time leading international goal scorer Christine Sinclair. After the match, Schmidt said, 'I don't think there's any words for how we're feeling right now. We're shook, we're disappointed.' newsArray.content: Chelsea want Brighton keeper Robert Sanchez - who has already agreed to join the Blues - but transfer fee and ongoing talks over ¬£105m-rated Moises Caicedo are proving an issue Robert Sanchez has fallen down the pecking order at Brighton in recent months The goalkeeper has been capped twice by Spain and was courted by England TRANSFER CONFIDENTIAL: Spurs line up Brennan Johnson if Harry Kane leaves By Simon Jones for MailOnline Updated: 09:25 EDT, 31 July 2023 e-mail View comments Chelsea want Brighton goalkeeper Robert Sanchez and he has agreed to join. The problem will be the fee and Chelsea's ongoing talks over a deal for ¬£105million-rated Moises Caicedo. Sanchez has fallen out of favour with Roberto de Zerbi and wants to get away with Chelsea a perfect opportunity. Former Brighton goalkeeping coach Ben Roberts is at Chelsea and played a big part in mentoring Sanchez's development. Indeed, the 6ft 6ins shot-stopper credits his 'mental fortitude' to Roberts's influence. Though born in Spain and capped twice by them, Sanchez counts as homegrown as he has been brought up through Brighton's academy since the age of 15, and was courted by England prior to his Spain call-up. Chelsea are eyeing a move for Brighton goalkeeper Robert Sanchez (left) this summer Mauricio Pochettino is keen to strengthen in between the sticks ahead of the new season That could prove vital with Chelsea's current recruitment pattern and the fact the likes of Conor Gallagher could still depart. Chelsea have also been maintaining contact with Southampton over Romeo Lavia and Tino Livramento. Mauricio Pochettino has confirmed new signing from Rennes, Lesley Ugochukwu, should go on loan to Strasbourg with winger Angelo Gabriel expected to follow. Regardless of shared ownership rules permit only three loans allowed between clubs. They still plan to sign striker Elye Wahi from Montpellier with Strasbourg in mind so Chelsea will need to find different temporary, or permanent, homes for a number of the players they are stockpiling. Impressive midfielder Andrey Santos has interest from eight clubs, home and abroad. newsArray.description: SIMON JONES: The Blades are pursuing a loan deal for the USA international who was player of the year at Birmingham last season and, was a target for Rangers this summer.
newsArray.content: Sheffield United boss Paul Heckingbottom holds talks with former Man United star Axel Tuanzebe, as Blades also enter discussions with Arsenal defender Auston Trusty Axel Tuanzebe, 25, was released by Manchester United at the end of 2022-23 Auston Trusty had been a target for Scottish giants Rangers earlier this summer TRANSFER CONFIDENTIAL: Spurs line up Brennan Johnson if Harry Kane leaves By Simon Jones for MailOnline Updated: 14:34 BST, 31 July 2023 e-mail View comments Sheffield United boss Paul Heckingbottom has been in talks with former Manchester United defender Axel Tuanzebe. The newly-promoted Premier League side have also opened talks with Arsenal for defender Auston Trusty. The Blades are pursuing a loan deal for the USA international who was player of the year at Birmingham City last season and, as Confidential readers will know, was a target for Rangers earlier this summer. Sheffield United are keen to get the deal for Trusty over the line, and are set to receive a financial injection from the sale of Iliman Ndiaye to Marseille for ¬£18million. Arsenal would ideally prefer a sale for Trusty. They need to raise funds to offset their spending and appease Financial Fair Play concerns. Sheffield United have opened talks with Arsenal's Auston Trusty and are eyeing Axel Tuanzebe Paul Heckingbottom's side are back in the Premier League after a fine Championship season Arsenal are targeting Brentford keeper David Raya, but face competition from Bayern Munich They want Brentford goalkeeper David Raya but early signs are they will offer around ¬£15m and Brentford are determined to take ¬£30m at least. Arsenal could sell Matt Turner to help the move. The USA international is one on a long list of keepers courted by Nottingham Forest who want Dean Henderson and one other to start the season. Raya is highly regarded by Arsenal keeper coach Inaki Cana who worked with the 27-year-old at Brentford and believes he can provide Aaron Ramsdale with serious competition for the number one jersey. Bayern Munich have not totally given up on Raya but they were offering a loan with obligation and are now looking at Morocco international Yassine Bouno, or 'Bono' to his friends, of Sevilla. newsArray.title: Chelsea fans convinced the Blues are signing Kylian Mbappe after hearing Enzo Fernandez's comment
newsArray.description: Mail Sport reported on Sunday night that the Blues 'want to hijack Liverpool's' sensational move for the France World Cup winner.
newsArray.content: What was that, Enzo? Chelsea fans are convinced the Blues are signing Kylian Mbappe after hearing Fernandez's comment during trophy lift amid links with a sensational swoop for the PSG star Chelsea believe they may be signing Kylian Mbappe after Sunday's victory The Blues were crowned the first Premier League Summer Series champions Fans think Enzo Fernandez revealed the transfer during the celebrations By Ed Carruthers For Mailonline Updated: 09:33 EDT, 31 July 2023 e-mail 34 shares 2 View comments Chelsea fans are convinced that Enzo Fernandez may have revealed that the club are signing Kylian Mbappe, following their Premier League Summer Series victory . Mail Sport reported on Sunday night that the Blues 'want to hijack Liverpool's' sensational move for the France World Cup winner. It comes as the 24-year-old is edging closer to an exit from Paris Saint-Germain, after the club put him up for sale and left him out of their pre-season tour last week. The forward's ongoing contract saga with the Parisian outfit has soured their relationship so much so that the club are now hoping to cash in on their superstar, with Nasser Al-Khelaifi's side having accepted a jaw-dropping ¬£259million transfer offer for the forward. It's been made clear that he does not want to join the Saudi Pro League side , with Liverpool now reportedly 'holding talks' with the Frenchman , who has 12 months remaining on his contract at the Parc des Princes. Introducing your first-ever #PLSummerSeries champions: @ChelseaFC ! üèÜ pic.twitter.com/yFWiGzXqzO ‚Äî Premier League (@premierleague) July 30, 2023 Both Chelsea and Liverpool are interested in signing Kylian Mbappe (pictured) with the French superstar's future at Paris Saint-Germain very much up in the air Chelsea, meanwhile, hoisted the Premier League Summer Series title yesterday, and fans believe they over heard Enzo Fernandez (third from left) saying the Frenchman's name Chelsea, meanwhile, are also interested in signing the superstar and their fans seem to think that he could be on his way to Stamford Bridge after their Argentine midfielder was seemingly overheard to be saying his name after their 2-0 victory against Fulham on Sunday. Mauricio Pochettino's side subsequently clinched the pre-season title, having gone unbeaten in the tournament in the US, with Reece James and Thiago Silva stepping forward to lift the trophy alongside their team-mates. And just as they hoisted the cup into the air, fans believe they overheard their midfielder, Fernandez, saying Mbappe's name. 'I heard it loud and clear,' one said, while another added: 'Hearing that for the first time... What's he onto?' 'Can't wait for Boehly to offer Mbappe a 10-year contract,' one wrote. 'Proper weird thing to think of saying in the moment tbh... unless he knows something we dont,' another Twitter user added, posting a thinking-face emoji with the Tweet. Fans have been reacting on Twitter to claims that they overheard Enzo Fernandez say Mbappe's name during their trophy celebrations Pochettino has remained tight-lipped on the potential to sign Mbappe (pictured) in the past According to the Daily Record , Chelsea would be interested in signing the French forward in a player plus-cash deal. But Pochettino last week refused to confirm that his side were interested in signing Mbappe claiming that the situation was 'delicate.' 'I need to be conscious,' the manager told Sky Sports after his side's 1-1 draw against Newcastle last week. 'I cannot talk because everything that you talk is too much noise, it is a very delicate situation and it is a situation they need to fix in Paris with Kylian, Kylian with PSG 'But from our side, nothing to say. We are working in our reality, their reality is different - and they for sure have another reality. 'And from my side, nothing to say - only to support them and hope they find the best solution for both sides.' newsArray.content: AUCKLAND (AFP): Nouhaila Benzina became the first player to wear a hijab during a Women‚Äôs World Cup game when she sported the Muslim headscarf in Morocco‚Äôs match against South Korea on Sunday. World governing body FIFA lifted its ban on footballers wearing the hijab nearly a decade ago, after previous concerns over player safety. The 25-year-old defender Benzina, who plays her club football in Morocco, ran out against South Korea in Adelaide to write her name in the history books. Benzina shared social media posts in the lead-up to the World Cup about wearing a hijab, but has not spoken to the media in Australia and New Zealand about it. She told broadcaster Al Jazeera recently it would be a proud moment. ‚ÄúLots of work was done over many years, and thank God it had a positive result,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúWe hope to play at a high level and honour Moroccans.‚Äù Several other sports have lifted hijab bans in recent years including basketball, but it is still not allowed during official football matches in France. The Moroccan women, coached by Frenchman Reynald Pedros, are at their first Women‚Äôs World Cup on the back of a historic runners-up finish at the 2022 Women‚Äôs Africa Cup of Nations. They were thrashed 6-0 by Germany in their tournament opener, with Benzina remaining on the bench.

newsArray.description: Sideline microphones have captured the disgusting spray a Canadian player delivered to Matildas hero Hayley Raso as she lay prone on the ground in Australia's 4-0 win on Monday night.
newsArray.content: Canadian star is busted in X-rated outburst about match-winning Matilda Hayley Raso - and it went to air uncensored during World Cup clash Matildas thrashed Canada 4-0 Substitute Canadian player was not pleased Launched foul-mouthed spray By Josh Alston For Daily Mail Australia Updated: 13:51 BST, 31 July 2023 e-mail 1 View comments Sideline microphones have captured the disgusting spray a Canadian player delivered to Matildas hero Hayley Raso as she lay prone on the ground in Australia's 4-0 win on Monday night. It was do-or-die for the two nations in the final World Cup group match in Melbourne and the home side shot out of the blocks to dominate from the outset - even as captain Sam Kerr remained benched with a calf injury . Raso was named best on ground with two clutch goals that handed Australia a place in the knockout stages and their first win over powerhouse Canada since 2008. There was plenty of feeling in the match, with the Canadians ranked seventh in the world and fancied to go deep in the tournament prior to the Matildas demolition job. Chapman was not happy with something Australian coach Tony Gustavsson and launched a mighty, foul-mouthed spray in return Raso came off second best in the content but Chapman was not willing to concede that it was her fault after the challenge With the result all but secured, Canadian player Allysha Chapman collided with Raso, with the Australian coming off second best and requiring medical attention on the pitch. Australia coach Tony Gustavsson had some words for Chapman that weren't picked up on the broadcast, and the Canadian erupted in reply. 'She f***ing jumped into me you t***!' she yelled. Commentator David Basheer said: 'Allysha Chapman looked over to Tony Gustavsson and said some pretty stern words. 'It was just a coming together, really. It wasn't Chapman's doing. 'It was just Raso's determination to win the ball.' 'I don't think there was any real malice in the challenge,' fellow commentator and former Matilda Grace Gill added. 'A coming together of bodies, Raso coming off a little worse for wear.' Gustavsson and Raso had the last laugh, sharing an embrace after the Matildas smashed Canada 4-0 to dump them out of the tournament Commentators agreed that the collision was accidental, with both players having eyes only for the ball Fans were disgusted by the tirade, especially as it occured while Raso was down and potentially injured. 'Allysha Chapman‚Äôs foul mouth and evil ways make me sick,' one fan posted. 'Look at the scoreboard, you t***. Sincerely, Australia,' replied another. 'Allysha Chapman displaying the most fight this [Canadian team] have shown this tournament,' posted a third. Oooh, langage, Allysha Chapman! üòÇ ‚Äî Emil (@EmilASoccer) July 31, 2023 Raso had the last laugh, though, with the Matildas topping their group for the first time in a World Cup thanks in large part to her heroics. 'Getting a tattoo of Hayley Raso‚Äôs face on my face,' one enthusiastic fan proclaimed. 'Hayley Raso. Absolute gun of a player,' posted another. 'This has been a Hayley Raso masterclass,' added another. Australia now wait on the result of the Group D clash between England and China to see who their opposition will be in the round of 16. The Matildas will now focus on emulating or bettering their quarter final appearances at the 2007, 2011 and 2015 World Cup tournaments. newsArray.title: Matildas player ratings: See which Australian stars excelled and who struggled in World Cup demolition of Canada
newsArray.description: In an display that was light years ahead of their effort in the shock loss to Nigeria last week, the Matildas were dominant from the first whistle to the last against Canada.
newsArray.content: Matildas player ratings: See which Australian stars excelled and who struggled in World Cup demolition of Canada Aussies dominant from the outset in 4-0 win Hayley Raso named best on ground with two goals Mary Fowler also among home team's best By Kristy Williams For Daily Mail Australia Updated: 13:56 BST, 31 July 2023 e-mail View comments The Matildas were dominant against Canada from start to finish despite the crushing pressure of knowing their home World Cup would have been over if they'd lost in Melbourne following their shock defeat to Nigeria last Thursday. Hayley Raso scored a double, Mary Fowler should have had two herself but had one controversially ruled offside by the VAR, and stand-in skipper Steph Catley put an exclamation point on proceedings with a late penalty. It was the biggest win by a Matildas side at any World Cup - and even better, the Aussies were so firmly in control that injured superstar Sam Kerr never had to be called on. Here's how Daily Mail Australia rated the home team... Mackenzie Arnold: 8.5 Made a few poor errors last game that may have dented the confidence, but 'Macca' was back at her best in this match, pulling off a couple of crucial saves but also returning to the brilliant distributor she had been. Ellie Carpenter: 6 Brilliant to see the Lyon star at least back to some decent form. She is such a talented player - one of the best in the world - but where has that spark gone? Carpenter was determined to defend better than the diabolical Nigeria match, and she certainly did that, but Aussies want to see the superstar they fell in love with. Clare Hunt: 8.5 The girl from the tiny town of Grenfell (NSW), was mammoth. Not many better players on the field than Hunt, who has well and truly played Kennedy and Polkinhorne out of the first-choice CB spot. The challenges she won, the time she won them and the distribution she afforded those ahead of her were phenomenal. She won't want the attention but she was as important as any Aussie player. Alanna Kennedy: 6.5 Many expected her to concede her place to Clare Polkinghorne, but Gustavsson picked his most talented centre back. While she didn't reach the heights of a brilliant game against Ireland, she was calmer than the Ireland match and despite a few passing errors she was Steph Catley: 8.5 Goodness, has the stand-in skipper stood up or what? Faded, as expected given the state of the match, as the game went on but the Arsenal jet was at her lethal best down the left - setting up the opening goal with an exquisite touch. Then came the defensive grunt - she was strong. Hayley Raso: 9 Hang it in the Louvre. The fan favourite celebrating a goal that sent the entire nation nuts to open the scoring was one thing - but the new Real Madrid signee kept showing her new Galactico club why they brought her in. Relentless as always but her positioning and nous were brilliant, and she seemed to regain confidence and composure with her first touch, and the fact she, yet again, often finished behind Carpenter showed how hard she worked. Katrina Gorry: 7 Not the workhorse's greatest match, with a fair few very, heavy touches, but the side is so much better for her in it, regardless. Looks to be very sore, and will be more crucial than Sam Kerr when it comes to the playoffs. Worked herself sore, and chased every mistake. Kyra Cooney-Cross: 7.5 A brilliant distributor, Gorry might have been the side's most important passer, but this Young Matilda has been sensational. Did she get found out? Don't think so. She never looks flustered, but has a better touch than her veteran counterpart. Emily Van Egmond: 6 Flirted between centre midfield and forwards, and wasn't much of an influence in either. But she certainly didn't let anyone down, despite not posing much of a threat. Caitlin Foord: 9 The happiest person in the Australian side Mary Fowler could play. The shackles were unleashed and the Arsenal star looked like a different player, free of the huge burden she looked to shoulder in the Nigeria loss. The first touch, the through balls...the effort chasing back in defence - she was a woman possessed. Mary Fowler: 9 Fowler is ecstatic after her goal gave the Aussies a 3-0 lead - after her first score was controversially called back for offside by the VAR One thing's for sure, when Sam Kerr (hopefully) lines up in the Round of 16, Mary Fowler will be there either way. What a stunning performance. The first touch, the dribbling, the passing... it's all Mary's world and we are just living in it. Clare Polkinghorne: N/A Subbed on late, as she has the last two, and fortunately didn't need to make a difference in this one. newsArray.title: Urgent warning ahead of Dublin‚Äôs homecoming celebrations as fans warned of severe issues around All-Ireland celebrations
creator: Vincent Whelan
newsArray.content: DUBLIN fans intent on attending the homecoming for their All-Ireland winning heroes have been warned to take heed of several instructions. Fresh off an epic win over their greatest rivals Kerry , the capital will see a huge celebration occur in Smithfield Square on Monday evening. The event is due to get under way from 6.30 pm. However, supporters are being advised to allow plenty of time in order to get there on time since it will be guaranteed to be extremely busy. In addition to that, access to Smithfield Square is only going to permitted from North King Street, Friary Avenue and Thundercut Alley. The miserable weather means attendees should also allow extra time to ensure they get there safe and sound. Dublin City Council is asking people to use public transport when travelling to and from the event, which is a family-friendly alcohol-free event. The Lord Mayor Daith√≠ de R√≥iste said: ‚ÄúWinning an All-Ireland title is always amazing, but beating Kerry in the final? "It doesn‚Äôt come much better than that! "I can‚Äôt wait to see everyone in Smithfield this evening. Let‚Äôs have a party and celebrate the boys in blue!‚Äù There will be entertainment provided on the evening, before the team takes to the stage to be welcomed by MC and RTE commentator Marty Morrissey. To celebrate the team‚Äôs achievement, Beckett Bridge and the Smithfield Sails will light up in blue both on Sunday evening and Monday evening. While Sunday's match was similarly blighted by the weather, it still wound up being a fascinating battle. Dublin were in most people's eyes the marginally better side over the course of the seventy-odd minutes. They had been in control prior to David Clifford pulling a magical pass out of nowhere just before half-time like a magician pulling a rabbit out of his hat. That teed up Paul Geaney's composed finish into the back of the net to send the Munster kingpins in at the break with a one-point lead. But Gavin White's costly turnover around the 50th minute resulted in Paddy Small blasting home a goal of their own. And while the defending champions fought resolutely to the bitter end, The Sky Blues kicked for home thanks to late scores from Brian Fenton and sub Dean Rock.

newsArray.title: USA legend Alexi Lalas takes a brutal swipe at Canada after it is dumped out of the World Cup in the group stages
newsArray.description: For the first time in women's football history, the reigning Olympic gold medalists have been knocked out in the Group Stages of the following World Cup.
newsArray.content: USA legend Alexi Lalas takes a brutal swipe at Canada after it is dumped out of the World Cup in the group stages Canada is out of the Women's World Cup after a humbling 4-0 defeat to Australia Lalas - ever the provocateur - didn't miss an opportunity to take a dig at Canada DailyMail.com provides all the latest international sports news By Jake Fenner For Dailymail.Com Updated: 09:41 EDT, 31 July 2023 e-mail View comments For the first time in women's football history, the reigning Olympic gold medalists have been knocked out in the Group Stages of the following World Cup. Canada, who came in with the eleventh best odds to lift the trophy in Australia, lost 4-0 to hosts Australia on Monday night in Melbourne . Coupled with a Nigeria 0-0 draw against Ireland, that meant that the Super Falcons would join the hosts in the knockout stages. Canada joins three men's teams that won the Olympic gold but got knocked out in the group stages: Czechoslovakia (gold in 1980, eliminated in 1982), the Soviet Union (gold in 1988, fell in 1990) and Cameroon (won gold in 2000, knocked out in 2002). Never one to pass up on a time to mock America's rivals, former US men's national team defender Alexi Lalas took a jab at Canada - all while former CanWNT keeper Karina Leblanc was sitting on the same desk. Alexi Lalas (far right) jumped on the opportunity to provide a sly dig at Canada's misery The goals came early and often for host nation Australia, who defeated the Canadians 4-0 This loss, coupled with a Nigeria draw, means Canada are the first women's Olympic gold medal winners in history to be knocked out in the group stages of the following World Cup "They really came out and fought. Sam Kerr did not have to play and that was exactly what they wanted." @RobStoneONFOX , @karinaleblanc , @CarliLloyd , and @AlexiLalas recap The Matildas emphatic victory over Canada as they go into the Round of 16 with incredible momentum! üá¶üá∫ pic.twitter.com/lUBjIgsiyJ ‚Äî FOX Soccer (@FOXSoccer) July 31, 2023 Lalas likened the tournament to a game of musical chairs, saying, 'the music has stopped and Canada is left without a chair. Sindely, Lalas added, 'Congratulations on winning the Gold Medal at the Olympics.' Prior to that jab, Lalas gave a pretty fair review of the state of the match. 'It was... emphatic. It was an exclamation point, and now they go into the Round of 16 with incredible momentum. Out wide they were dominant, in terms of finishing they were dominant, in set pieces they were ultimately dominant. 'And so I know Karina, this probably hurts. But it may hurt a little bit less because Canada was never even in this game. Leblanc, reluctantly added, 'I would have to agree with you. I'm proudly Canadian but I tip my hats off to Australia. They deserved it, they dominated. 'I mean you talk about that left hand side [Steph] Catley, Caitlin Foord, [Hayley] Raso, like everybody did what they needed to do today except for Canada. 'And you know, its disappointing. You're coming off an Olympic win, you hope for more but I don't think there's any Canadian who watched this game or who has played the game who would say they deserved it tonight. 'The good thing is its a home country a home team one of the things you as a former player you want that, it's good for the game but yeah, that's how it ended tonight.' It's jubilation for the host nation, who managed to win the group with this victory on Monday But it's likely the end of the road at the World Cup for Canada legends Christine Sinclair (L) and Sophie Schmidt (R) - the latter of which already announced her retirement from the team A fellow person on the desk, USWNT legend Carli Lloyd praised Australia, saying they were better, 'In every aspect of the game. From start to finish, they scored early - we said it in the pre-game the team that was going to score early was the team that was most likely going to come out and win this game. 'I thought defensively they were compact they made it really difficult for Canada to go centrally. And Foord, in her more natural position out on that left hand side between her and Catley just deadly they made so much happen. Raso getting on the end of those goals, they really came out and fought and Sam Kerr did not have to play and that's exactly what they wanted.' As for Canada, this defeat marks the country's fifth Group Stage exit at a Women's World Cup - following two straight knockout stage appearances. It's the final game in a Canada uniform for one of the country's brightest stars - Sophie Schmidt and likely the last World Cup game for the world's all-time leading international goal scorer Christine Sinclair. After the match, Schmidt said, 'I don't think there's any words for how we're feeling right now. We're shook, we're disappointed.' newsArray.content: Chelsea want Brighton keeper Robert Sanchez - who has already agreed to join the Blues - but transfer fee and ongoing talks over ¬£105m-rated Moises Caicedo are proving an issue Robert Sanchez has fallen down the pecking order at Brighton in recent months The goalkeeper has been capped twice by Spain and was courted by England TRANSFER CONFIDENTIAL: Spurs line up Brennan Johnson if Harry Kane leaves By Simon Jones for MailOnline Updated: 09:25 EDT, 31 July 2023 e-mail View comments Chelsea want Brighton goalkeeper Robert Sanchez and he has agreed to join. Former Brighton goalkeeping coach Ben Roberts is at Chelsea and played a big part in mentoring Sanchez's development. 'I need to be conscious,' the manager told Sky Sports after his side's 1-1 draw against Newcastle last week. 'I cannot talk because everything that you talk is too much noise, it is a very delicate situation and it is a situation they need to fix in Paris with Kylian, Kylian with PSG 'But from our side, nothing to say. We are working in our reality, their reality is different - and they for sure have another reality. World governing body FIFA lifted its ban on footballers wearing the hijab nearly a decade ago, after previous concerns over player safety. The 25-year-old defender Benzina, who plays her club football in Morocco, ran out against South Korea in Adelaide to write her name in the history books. Benzina shared social media posts in the lead-up to the World Cup about wearing a hijab, but has not spoken to the media in Australia and New Zealand about it. She told broadcaster Al Jazeera recently it would be a proud moment. ‚ÄúLots of work was done over many years, and thank God it had a positive result,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúWe hope to play at a high level and honour Moroccans.‚Äù Several other sports have lifted hijab bans in recent years including basketball, but it is still not allowed during official football matches in France. The Moroccan women, coached by Frenchman Reynald Pedros, are at their first Women‚Äôs World Cup on the back of a historic runners-up finish at the 2022 Women‚Äôs Africa Cup of Nations. newsArray.content: Canadian star is busted in X-rated outburst about match-winning Matilda Hayley Raso - and it went to air uncensored during World Cup clash Matildas thrashed Canada 4-0 Substitute Canadian player was not pleased Launched foul-mouthed spray By Josh Alston For Daily Mail Australia Updated: 13:51 BST, 31 July 2023 e-mail 1 View comments Sideline microphones have captured the disgusting spray a Canadian player delivered to Matildas hero Hayley Raso as she lay prone on the ground in Australia's 4-0 win on Monday night. It was do-or-die for the two nations in the final World Cup group match in Melbourne and the home side shot out of the blocks to dominate from the outset - even as captain Sam Kerr remained benched with a calf injury . Raso was named best on ground with two clutch goals that handed Australia a place in the knockout stages and their first win over powerhouse Canada since 2008. There was plenty of feeling in the match, with the Canadians ranked seventh in the world and fancied to go deep in the tournament prior to the Matildas demolition job. Chapman was not happy with something Australian coach Tony Gustavsson and launched a mighty, foul-mouthed spray in return Raso came off second best in the content but Chapman was not willing to concede that it was her fault after the challenge With the result all but secured, Canadian player Allysha Chapman collided with Raso, with the Australian coming off second best and requiring medical attention on the pitch. Australia coach Tony Gustavsson had some words for Chapman that weren't picked up on the broadcast, and the Canadian erupted in reply. 'She f***ing jumped into me you t***!' she yelled. Commentator David Basheer said: 'Allysha Chapman looked over to Tony Gustavsson and said some pretty stern words. 'It was just a coming together, really. It wasn't Chapman's doing. 'It was just Raso's determination to win the ball.' 'I don't think there was any real malice in the challenge,' fellow commentator and former Matilda Grace Gill added. 'A coming together of bodies, Raso coming off a little worse for wear.' Gustavsson and Raso had the last laugh, sharing an embrace after the Matildas smashed Canada 4-0 to dump them out of the tournament Commentators agreed that the collision was accidental, with both players having eyes only for the ball Fans were disgusted by the tirade, especially as it occured while Raso was down and potentially injured. 'Allysha Chapman‚Äôs foul mouth and evil ways make me sick,' one fan posted. 'Look at the scoreboard, you t***. Sincerely, Australia,' replied another. 'Allysha Chapman displaying the most fight this [Canadian team] have shown this tournament,' posted a third. Oooh, langage, Allysha Chapman! üòÇ ‚Äî Emil (@EmilASoccer) July 31, 2023 Raso had the last laugh, though, with the Matildas topping their group for the first time in a World Cup thanks in large part to her heroics. 'Getting a tattoo of Hayley Raso‚Äôs face on my face,' one enthusiastic fan proclaimed. 'Hayley Raso. Absolute gun of a player,' posted another. 'This has been a Hayley Raso masterclass,' added another. Australia now wait on the result of the Group D clash between England and China to see who their opposition will be in the round of 16. The Matildas will now focus on emulating or bettering their quarter final appearances at the 2007, 2011 and 2015 World Cup tournaments. newsArray.title: Matildas player ratings: See which Australian stars excelled and who struggled in World Cup demolition of Canada
newsArray.description: In an display that was light years ahead of their effort in the shock loss to Nigeria last week, the Matildas were dominant from the first whistle to the last against Canada.
newsArray.content: Matildas player ratings: See which Australian stars excelled and who struggled in World Cup demolition of Canada Aussies dominant from the outset in 4-0 win Hayley Raso named best on ground with two goals Mary Fowler also among home team's best By Kristy Williams For Daily Mail Australia Updated: 13:56 BST, 31 July 2023 e-mail View comments The Matildas were dominant against Canada from start to finish despite the crushing pressure of knowing their home World Cup would have been over if they'd lost in Melbourne following their shock defeat to Nigeria last Thursday. Hayley Raso scored a double, Mary Fowler should have had two herself but had one controversially ruled offside by the VAR, and stand-in skipper Steph Catley put an exclamation point on proceedings with a late penalty. It was the biggest win by a Matildas side at any World Cup - and even better, the Aussies were so firmly in control that injured superstar Sam Kerr never had to be called on. Here's how Daily Mail Australia rated the home team... Mackenzie Arnold: 8.5 Made a few poor errors last game that may have dented the confidence, but 'Macca' was back at her best in this match, pulling off a couple of crucial saves but also returning to the brilliant distributor she had been. Ellie Carpenter: 6 Brilliant to see the Lyon star at least back to some decent form. She is such a talented player - one of the best in the world - but where has that spark gone? Carpenter was determined to defend better than the diabolical Nigeria match, and she certainly did that, but Aussies want to see the superstar they fell in love with. Clare Hunt: 8.5 The girl from the tiny town of Grenfell (NSW), was mammoth. Not many better players on the field than Hunt, who has well and truly played Kennedy and Polkinhorne out of the first-choice CB spot. The challenges she won, the time she won them and the distribution she afforded those ahead of her were phenomenal. She won't want the attention but she was as important as any Aussie player. Alanna Kennedy: 6.5 Many expected her to concede her place to Clare Polkinghorne, but Gustavsson picked his most talented centre back. While she didn't reach the heights of a brilliant game against Ireland, she was calmer than the Ireland match and despite a few passing errors she was Steph Catley: 8.5 Goodness, has the stand-in skipper stood up or what? Faded, as expected given the state of the match, as the game went on but the Arsenal jet was at her lethal best down the left - setting up the opening goal with an exquisite touch. Then came the defensive grunt - she was strong. Hayley Raso: 9 Hang it in the Louvre. The fan favourite celebrating a goal that sent the entire nation nuts to open the scoring was one thing - but the new Real Madrid signee kept showing her new Galactico club why they brought her in. Relentless as always but her positioning and nous were brilliant, and she seemed to regain confidence and composure with her first touch, and the fact she, yet again, often finished behind Carpenter showed how hard she worked. Katrina Gorry: 7 Not the workhorse's greatest match, with a fair few very, heavy touches, but the side is so much better for her in it, regardless. Looks to be very sore, and will be more crucial than Sam Kerr when it comes to the playoffs. Worked herself sore, and chased every mistake. Kyra Cooney-Cross: 7.5 A brilliant distributor, Gorry might have been the side's most important passer, but this Young Matilda has been sensational. Did she get found out? Don't think so. She never looks flustered, but has a better touch than her veteran counterpart. Emily Van Egmond: 6 Flirted between centre midfield and forwards, and wasn't much of an influence in either. But she certainly didn't let anyone down, despite not posing much of a threat. Caitlin Foord: 9 The happiest person in the Australian side Mary Fowler could play. The shackles were unleashed and the Arsenal star looked like a different player, free of the huge burden she looked to shoulder in the Nigeria loss. The first touch, the through balls...the effort chasing back in defence - she was a woman possessed. Mary Fowler: 9 Fowler is ecstatic after her goal gave the Aussies a 3-0 lead - after her first score was controversially called back for offside by the VAR One thing's for sure, when Sam Kerr (hopefully) lines up in the Round of 16, Mary Fowler will be there either way. What a stunning performance. The first touch, the dribbling, the passing... it's all Mary's world and we are just living in it. Clare Polkinghorne: N/A Subbed on late, as she has the last two, and fortunately didn't need to make a difference in this one. creator: Vincent Whelan
newsArray.content: DUBLIN fans intent on attending the homecoming for their All-Ireland winning heroes have been warned to take heed of several instructions. Fresh off an epic win over their greatest rivals Kerry , the capital will see a huge celebration occur in Smithfield Square on Monday evening. The event is due to get under way from 6.30 pm. However, supporters are being advised to allow plenty of time in order to get there on time since it will be guaranteed to be extremely busy. In addition to that, access to Smithfield Square is only going to permitted from North King Street, Friary Avenue and Thundercut Alley. The miserable weather means attendees should also allow extra time to ensure they get there safe and sound. Dublin City Council is asking people to use public transport when travelling to and from the event, which is a family-friendly alcohol-free event. The Lord Mayor Daith√≠ de R√≥iste said: ‚ÄúWinning an All-Ireland title is always amazing, but beating Kerry in the final? "It doesn‚Äôt come much better than that! "I can‚Äôt wait to see everyone in Smithfield this evening. Let‚Äôs have a party and celebrate the boys in blue!‚Äù There will be entertainment provided on the evening, before the team takes to the stage to be welcomed by MC and RTE commentator Marty Morrissey. To celebrate the team‚Äôs achievement, Beckett Bridge and the Smithfield Sails will light up in blue both on Sunday evening and Monday evening. While Sunday's match was similarly blighted by the weather, it still wound up being a fascinating battle. Dublin were in most people's eyes the marginally better side over the course of the seventy-odd minutes. They had been in control prior to David Clifford pulling a magical pass out of nowhere just before half-time like a magician pulling a rabbit out of his hat. That teed up Paul Geaney's composed finish into the back of the net to send the Munster kingpins in at the break with a one-point lead. But Gavin White's costly turnover around the 50th minute resulted in Paddy Small blasting home a goal of their own. And while the defending champions fought resolutely to the bitter end, The Sky Blues kicked for home thanks to late scores from Brian Fenton and sub Dean Rock.
